title: Joy of the Waters
creditLine: Gift of the Friends of American Art

title: Concave or Standing Woman
creditLine: Gift of Frank C. Springer, Jr. in memory of his wife, Irving Moxley Springer
galleryLabel: This female figure, an elegantly abstracted form from the prime of the artist's career in Paris, reflects Archipenko's innovative exploration of form and space, void and concavity. As Archipenko observed: 'in art the shape of the empty space should be no less important than the meaning of the shape of solid matter.'
provenance: Purchase from Perls Gallery, New York, on April 6, 1962, by Frank C. Springer, Jr. and Irving Moxley Springer, Indianapolis, for $2,070 Partial gift to the IMA from Frank C. Springer, from 1991 through 2006.

title: Henry Look Unhitching
creditLine: Gift of Mr. and Mrs. Joseph Cantor
galleryLabel: Benton was the leader of the Regionalist artists who favored images of America, especially the rural Midwest. The rhythmic curving lines of the composition suggest the vitality of nature and are characteristic of Bentonâ€™s work.
provenance: Owned by Mr. and Mrs. Joseph Cantor
